articles.headline: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love Electric Scooters
articles.snippet: A week experiencing the e-scooter craze convinced our columnist that the devices aren’t an urban menace or a harbinger of the apocalypse. (In fact, they are pretty great.)
articles.abstract: A week experiencing the e-scooter craze convinced our columnist that the devices aren’t an urban menace or a harbinger of the apocalypse. (In fact, they are pretty great.)
articles.lead_paragraph: SANTA MONICA, Calif. — I wanted to hate the scooters. I really did.

articles.headline: Kim Jong-un’s Image Shift: From Nuclear Madman to Skillful Leader
articles.snippet: Can someone change so quickly? A summit meeting with President Trump will test the North Korean leader’s radical transformation.
articles.abstract: Can someone change so quickly? A summit meeting with President Trump will test the North Korean leader’s radical transformation.
articles.lead_paragraph: SEOUL, South Korea — He ordered his uncle executed and half brother assassinated. He spent millions developing and testing a hydrogen bomb and intercontinental ballistic missiles as his people suffered severe food shortages. He exchanged threats of nuclear annihilation with President Trump, calling the American leader a “mentally deranged U.S. dotard.”

articles.headline: Democrats Strengthen House Takeover Prospects in Primary Voting
articles.snippet: The Democratic Party skirted disaster in California and lined up likely gains in New Jersey, but Republicans saw some bright signs as well.
articles.abstract: The Democratic Party skirted disaster in California and lined up likely gains in New Jersey, but Republicans saw some bright signs as well.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Democrats enhanced their prospects for winning control of the House with Tuesday’s coast-to-coast primary results, skirting potential calamity in California and lining up likely gains in New Jersey and possible victories in Iowa and New Mexico.
articles.byline: By Carl Hulse and Jonathan Martin

articles.headline: U.S. Diplomats Evacuated in China as Medical Mystery Grows
articles.snippet: The illnesses have broadened a crisis that started in 2016, when American Embassy employees and their family members in Cuba began getting sick after hearing strange noises.
articles.abstract: The illnesses have broadened a crisis that started in 2016, when American Embassy employees and their family members in Cuba began getting sick after hearing strange noises.
articles.lead_paragraph: GUANGZHOU, China — A crisis over a mysterious ailment sickening American diplomats and their families — which began in Cuba and recently appeared in China — has widened as the State Department evacuated at least two more Americans from China on Wednesday.
articles.byline: By Steven Lee Myers and Jane Perlez

articles.headline: Kate Spade and Fashion’s Identity Crisis: When a Name Makes a Brand
articles.snippet: Even as the Kate Spade brand passed from owner to owner, shoppers never stopped associating the company with Ms. Spade, and Ms. Spade with good style.
articles.abstract: Even as the Kate Spade brand passed from owner to owner, shoppers never stopped associating the company with Ms. Spade, and Ms. Spade with good style.
articles.lead_paragraph: Soon after fans of Kate Spade learned that the designer had died in an apparent suicide on Tuesday, stunned customers remembered the handbags they purchased after their first big promotion, or the linens they were given for their first home, or the onesies in which they dressed their babies.

articles.headline: Amazon Wins Exclusive U.K. Rights to Broadcast Some Premier League Matches
articles.snippet: The push by the online retail giant highlights the seismic shifts happening in the world of entertainment, as digital outlets compete for eyeballs with traditional broadcasters.
articles.abstract: The push by the online retail giant highlights the seismic shifts happening in the world of entertainment, as digital outlets compete for eyeballs with traditional broadcasters.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — A generation ago, Sky, then an upstart satellite broadcaster, outbid rivals for the rights to televise the Premier League. The deal revolutionized the fortunes of the TV service, and helped turn the British soccer league into one of the world’s most watched — and lucrative — in sports.
articles.byline: By Prashant S. Rao and Kevin Draper

articles.headline: Trump Strikes Deal to Save China’s ZTE as North Korea Meeting Looms
articles.snippet: The Chinese telecommunications company has been at the center of a wide-ranging and complex trade dispute between Washington and Beijing.
articles.abstract: The Chinese telecommunications company has been at the center of a wide-ranging and complex trade dispute between Washington and Beijing.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump handed the Chinese telecommunications firm ZTE a lifeline on Thursday, agreeing to lift tough American sanctions over the objections of Republican lawmakers, his defense advisers and some of his own economic officials.

articles.headline: Piece by Piece, a Factory-Made Answer for a Housing Squeeze
articles.snippet: Developers are taking on residential building challenges by extending the concept of prefabricated housing to manufacture entire apartment buildings.
articles.abstract: Developers are taking on residential building challenges by extending the concept of prefabricated housing to manufacture entire apartment buildings.
articles.lead_paragraph: VALLEJO, Calif. — California is in the middle of an affordable-housing crisis that cities across the state are struggling to solve. Rick Holliday, a longtime Bay Area real estate developer, thinks one answer lies in an old shipyard in Vallejo, about 40 minutes northeast of San Francisco.
